events.text:
[i]Uggghhhhhhhh….
[color=#ffed29](I regret everything.)
[color=#ffed29](Everything is awful.)
[color=#ffed29](I barely slept…and when I did, it was on the toilet!!!)
At least you were with me, [tootroot]…
[i]Argggghhhh!
[color=#ffed29](My neck!)

[color=#ffed29](Well, this day is going to be the worst, and it’s all my fault.)
[color=#ffed29](Curse you, past Orven!!! You screwed over current Orven!)
[color=#ffed29](No, no, it’s okay, there’s no more, there can’t be anymore.)

[color=#ffed29](I have nothing in the tank, nothing more to offer.)
[color=#ffed29](Fully cleansed.)

[color=#ffed29](Let me just…drink some water and eat some white bread.)
[color=#ffed29](We’re going to pamper my stomach after what I did to it last night. Only the gentlest of foods!)

[color=#ffed29](Maybe that weird Spicy Bread would help…)
…...
[color=#ffed29](You know what, it would definitely just make things worse.)
[color=#ffed29](Okay, I ate something and didn’t need to poop, good signs.)
[color=#ffed29](Time to go, Orven.)
[i]Ughhh.
[color=#ffed29](Man, I conked out. Gramma always said I was a good sleeper.)
[color=#ffed29](Unless I'm stressed…I love how if my brain isn’t okay, then my whole body falls apart.)
[color=#ffed29](So, you gotta keep it together, Zanry…it’s a new day.)

WHO ARE WE?
TALLEST OF MEN.
[color=#ffed29](Time to make everyone proud.)

events.choice: Everyday, I just have to do my best…

events.text:
Trust your gut.
[color=#ffed29](Gotta take it decision by decision.)
[color=#ffed29](Do what’s right, Orven. That’s all you gotta do.)

events.choice: “You can’t be afraid of the doctor forever.”

events.text: [color=#ffed29](I can’t be afraid of the doctor forever.)
I can do this.
[color=#ffed29](I can be brave.)
[color=#ffed29](I’m going to go there open-minded, and I’m going to get good advice from a professional.)
[color=#ffed29](All I have to do is try.)
[color=#ffed29](I can’t look the Jones Brothers’ gift horse in the mouth.)
[color=#ffed29](No more of that!)
[color=#ffed29](We’re done with that now, okay? Time to do NORMAL digestion stuff.)
[color=#ffed29](I can’t be pooping all over the factory.)

[color=#ffed29](At least, every morning, I can smell bread.)
[color=#ffed29](And that’s a good smell.)
[color=#ffed29](And no matter what happened to me yesterday, the smell of fresh bread is still good.)
[color=#ffed29](And whenever I pass by ABP, I got this love-hate thing going on.)
[color=#ffed29](Love Rondeau, and Blight is great.)
[color=#ffed29](But there’s something about that “Spicy Bread” that’s going to cause me to die early.)
[color=#ffed29](Whether it’s the bread or the stress, that special is definitely going to take me out.)
Aw man, is Mrs. Langtree even coming to work today????

events.question: [color=#ffed29](Ahhhh, I didn’t even think about that.)

events.choice: There’s no point in going back.

events.text:
[color=#ffed29](But at this point, there’s no point in going back home.)
[color=#ffed29](I’m already halfway there, if I have to sit, I have to sit.)
[color=#ffed29](But if Mrs. Langtree DOES show up today, and I’m not there?)
[color=#ffed29](I think that it would be better if I soften the blow before management shows up.)

events.choice: I hope Mrs. Langtree comes today.

events.text:
[color=#ffed29](I hope she’s able to come.)
[color=#ffed29](I know she’s probably still upset, but it’s always nice to see her.)
[color=#ffed29](I’ll just make sure Herb doesn’t set her off. But I’m pretty sure he knows to give her some space after yesterday.)
[color=#ffed29](Plus, work-wise, it’s such a mess whenever she’s not here.)
[color=#ffed29](Literally AND figuratively!)

events.choice: Maybe it’s better she takes some time off.

events.text: [color=#ffed29](I love Mrs. Langtree, but she brings a lot of energy that I don’t know if the department can handle.)
[color=#ffed29](I guess that’s on management to deal with…but somehow, I feel like Miss Odiche will pass it off to me.)
[color=#ffed29](And I bet that would set Mrs. Langtree off, [i]haha.[/i])
[color=#ffed29](I don’t see her waiting for me…but I usually get here first.)

[color=#ffed29](I’ll just squat here until someone comes.)
…...
Mrs. Langtree! You’re here!
[color=#ffed29]([i]Haha[/i], I’m glad I wasn’t left waiting for long.)
I wish I wasn’t!
Well, I’m glad you’re here.
You’re just glad someone is here to open this gate for you so you’re not loitering outside the factory.
I mean, that’s definitely part of the reason why, [i]haha.
How are you feeling?
Today? Well, as good as I’ll ever be.

events.question: How about you, child? I know you had high hopes for [b]Remedium.

events.text: Honestly, I don’t know how I feel.

I feel like three denials is a lot?
And at some point you have to wonder what’s going wrong, you know?
I understand that, child.
And at this point, I’m tired of asking these questions.
If the higher-ups aren’t worried, why should I waste my breath?
And I’m not going to let [i]them[/i] get in the way of me providing for my family.
Is that all we can do, though? Give up?
What’s the point in caring more than your bosses?

Do you know how many years I’ve spent trying to understand Willamina and what she does?
And you know what I’ve come to realize?
What?

That it was a waste of my damn time!
And Sion is no better—I don’t wanna be anywhere near that guy.
Yeah, I get that…
Well, it’s a new day?
A new day, but the same work.
I’m glad to do it with you, though.
Aww, Orven, come here.
[color=#ffed29](Her hugs are always so warm.)

I’m glad to do this with you, too.
Good to know I’m not the only one with a head on her shoulders.
[i]Haha[/i]! Well, I learned from the best!

events.choice: I’m doing the same as always.

events.text: I know that the news wasn’t what we were hoping for, but I still think this can work.
I’m still the same, still hopeful we can move forward!
Hmm.
I don’t expect everyone to be here, though—I know the news wasn’t great.
But when we do get approved, I think we’ll all be relieved.
Yeah, well…I don’t know if I’ll ever be with you on this, Orven.

This old heart can’t do that anymore. Can’t do this anymore.
...…
What do you mean, Mrs. Langtree?
Nothing, child. Let’s get back to our work?

I’m glad to be working with you, Mrs. Langtree.
You’re one of the reasons I think we can pull this off.
Well…that faith might be misplaced, child.
But I do love working with you, Orven.
We got this!

events.choice: Wait for her to talk first.

events.text:
[color=#ffed29](If she wants to talk about yesterday, I’ll let her bring it up first.)
…...

What’s wrong, child, why are you suddenly so quiet?
You’re always chatting my ear off in the morning.

Oh!
I didn’t realize I was usually so talkative, [i]haha.
Not to everyone, but definitely to me!
You afraid I’m going to run off again?

events.question: [color=#ffed29](Uh oh, this feels like a question where there’s no right answer.)

events.text: [i]Ha[/i], I can tell that’s a yes.

I’m fine, child. I’m the last thing you should be worried about.
I gotta get paid, after all.
What did you end up doing after you got home from work?

Well, I got myself a little treat and went home!
I kicked my legs up and relaxed.
Had myself a good afternoon.
[i]Haha[/i], yeah, I think you definitely had a better afternoon than me.
What did you do yesterday?

events.choice: I went to talk to the apothecaries that reviewed us…

events.text: I might have talked to the apothecaries that reviewed us?
Boy…

I talked to Miss Odiche and Mr. Gungand, first!
And they didn’t tell me [i]anything[/i]!

[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1]SO YOU WENT BEHIND THEIR BACKS?
[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1]BOY, ARE YOU OUT OF YOUR MIND?
What did this do?
Well, now I know [i]why[/i] we’re being denied! And—

AND WHAT?  
AND YOU’RE GOING TO TELL THE PEOPLE KEEPING THIS INFORMATION FROM YOU THAT YOU SUDDENLY KNOW THE ANSWER TO THEIR PROBLEMS?
OH SURE, I’M POSITIVE THEY’LL LISTEN TO YOU AFTER THEY SPECIFICALLY TRIED TO KEEP THIS PROBLEM FROM YOU.

OR MAYBE YOU’LL DO THIS BEHIND THEIR BACKS?
HOW LONG DO YOU THINK YOU CAN KEEP THAT UP?
I…I know it was impulsive, but what was I supposed to do???
YOUR JOB, ORVEN.
THEY DON’T DESERVE THIS LEVEL OF DEDICATION!
But people need a cure for this disease!
And it’s going to come from you?

You want to stay in Ventreville, don’t you?
Working for Mister Avidine, right?
I mean, of course…

Then let this go. It won’t change anything.
They’re not willing to budge, so you’re wasting your time.
You understand me? You’re going to do amazing things, but not under these nut jobs.
[color=#ffed29](…but then who will make the cure?)
I understand…

I know it sounds harsh, child, but it’s the way things are.
I just don’t want to see you getting fired.
I get that. Thanks for looking out for me, Mrs. Langtree.
I really like working with you, so I’d hate to get fired because of something dumb.
I really like working with you, too, Orven.

You just gotta remember that this is the job that pays you, and nothing more.
You shouldn’t care more than your superiors.
If they aren’t worried, then neither are we.
Understood?
Understood.
[color=#ffed29](I don’t know if she should know about the visit to the Apotheca.)
Nothing new for me, just doing my job.

events.question: [color=#ffed29](Ahh, I gotta get better at lying!)
[color=#ffed29](I need to redirect this conversation. What would Mrs. Langtree want to talk about?)

events.text: Well, I talked with both Miss Odiche [i]and[/i] Mr. Gungand, yesterday.
Oh, your day was definitely worse than mine, then.

What did those two say to you?
Nothing worthwhile, I’m sure.
[color=#ffed29](Oh, she’s hooked. Nice!)
Yeah, it was pretty bad.
Miss Odiche was the usual. It’s incredible how much she can say and yet nothing is meaningful, you know?
Mhmm, classic Willamina.
And, I got pulled aside by Mr. Gungand.
That can’t be good.
It wasn’t.
Guess what he did?

I bet he scolded you for something ridiculous.
He really has it out for you.
Right??? I feel like it’s personal!
He was mad that I shushed people for him.
Well, that’s a him problem—if he spoke like a normal person this wouldn’t be an issue.

But he’s always mumbling to himself.
Honestly, I just tune out everything he says. It’s too much effort to try and decipher him.
If he’s not going to try to be heard, I’m not going to try to hear him.

He was so mad, though.
I feel like everything I do makes him mad.
I wouldn’t be surprised.
He must feel threatened by you.
Threatened??? How could I possibly be threatening?

You’re smart, child.
You’re smart and determined and you had a one-on-one with the boss.
Plus, you’re actually likable.
But, these are all [i]good[/i] things, child, so you don’t have anything to worry about.
He’s got his own stuff to take care of. And you can’t take care of it for him.
You understand?
Understood.
And if that bully keeps harassing you…there are good jobs available at the [b]Valentine Mill.
Are you quitting, Mrs. Langtree???
Not quitting, but looking.
Sometimes, it’s all just too much.
Please don’t go, Mrs. Langtree…I don’t know what I’d do without you here with me.

Aww, sweet child.
Don’t worry, I’ll be here for long. I’m just looking.
Or you could come with me! Just let me know, and we can jump ship together.
I don’t think one month at a job looks very good for me, [i]haha.
I’ll say we’re a packaged deal, you and me.
[i]Haha[/i], I appreciate that!
I got pulled aside by Mr. Gungand, yesterday.

Oh, that is definitely a bad day.
Why’d he do that?
[color=#ffed29](Nice, she’s hooked!)
Guess what he did?

I bet he scolded you for something ridiculous.
He really has it out for you.
Right??? I feel like it’s personal!
He was mad that I shushed people for him.
Well, that’s a him problem—if he spoke like a normal person this wouldn’t be an issue.

But he’s always mumbling to himself.
Honestly, I just tune out everything he says. It’s too much effort to try and decipher him.
If he’s not going to try to be heard, I’m not going to try to hear him.

He was so mad, though.
I feel like everything I do makes him mad.
I wouldn’t be surprised.
He must feel threatened by you.
Threatened??? How could I possibly be threatening?

You’re smart, child.
You’re smart and determined and you had a one-on-one with the boss.
Plus, you’re actually likable.
But, these are all [i]good[/i] things, child, so you don’t have anything to worry about.
He’s got his own stuff to take care of. And you can’t take care of it for him.
You understand?
Understood.
And if that bully keeps harassing you…there are good jobs available at the [b]Valentine Mill.
Are you quitting, Mrs. Langtree???
Not quitting, but looking.
Sometimes, it’s all just too much.
Please don’t go, Mrs. Langtree…I don’t know what I’d do without you here with me.

Aww, sweet child.
Don’t worry, I’ll be here for long. I’m just looking.
Or you could come with me! Just let me know, and we can jump ship together.
I don’t think one month at a job looks very good for me, [i]haha.
I’ll say we’re a packaged deal, you and me.
[i]Haha[/i], I appreciate that!
Well, I talked with Herb.
And? What, did he tell you some nonsense about believing in the product again?
I just think he really believes in it…
He’s a dull one, he is. Feel bad for him.
Mrs. Langtree, please don’t talk about Herb like that.
Why? It’s true and you know it.
And I’m tired of him and his nonsense!

Just like how you can [i]choose[/i] to hang out with your friend, I can [i]choose[/i] to think that conversing with him is annoying.
And [i]choose[/i] to avoid being annoyed.
He’s a good guy.

You can hang out with him if you want to, Orven.
But just leave me out of it.
I don’t wanna have anything to do with Herb, anymore.

Understood…
[color=#ffed29](I’m so sorry, Herb, I think I made things worse.)
I know he can’t help it, but it’s gotten on my last nerve.
I can’t afford anymore mess or stress at this job.

You can hang out with him if you want to, Orven, but just leave me out of it.
I don’t wanna have anything to do with Herb, anymore.

I understand...
[color=#ffed29](I’m so sorry, Herb, I think I made things worse.)
[color=#ffed29](Ah! Took too long to think.)
What have you been up to?
Okay, the truth is I did something that you might not like…
Okay, the truth is I did something that you might not like…
Nothing that unusual, work was work.
As expected.
As it will be today.
Is work always the same, even when the projects change?

There have been many projects like [b]Remedium[/b], before.
Some work, some don’t.
You just can’t emotionally invest in any of them. It’s just too much effort for the pay that we get.

So don’t.
You understand, boy? You’ve got a big heart that can be occupied by so much more than this.
Say, do you have a girlfriend, Orven?

Mrs. Langtree, I’ve been in this city for one month!
I don’t have that much game!

[i]Haha[/i]! Don’t worry child, you’ll meet someone wonderful soon.
You’re a catch!
You know, my neighbor’s sister’s daughter is around your age…

[i]Haha[/i], no thank you, Mrs. Langtree.
I’m still getting used to things here.
I don’t think a blind date with your neighbor's sister’s daughter will help.
I’m on the lookout!
[i]Haha[/i], please don’t. I’m alright.
Okay, okay! But if I see someone and happen to bring you up, don’t blame me!
I’ve only been here a month! Give me some time!

Don’t settle, though. You’re a catch!
You deserve a good girl.
Sure, sure, just let me cook, Mrs. Langtree.
Well, if I see someone nice and pretty, I’ll tell them about you.
[i]Haha[/i], who doesn’t like meeting someone nice and pretty?
Exactly.
